Being smarter is different than being more knowledgeable. They have to know more within their culture because one person has more than one thing to do for their group of people to sustain their standard of living.

Our society is much more developed, and have more people, so we do not need to use everyone for varying tasks.

This allows us to specialize in certain fields- which may limit us as an individual, but allows us to prosper as a society. 

And, one can take it upon themselves to learn.

That is a kickass loom -- the setup is very clever, and I love the foot pedals for moving the positions of the warp threads up and down. Movable tripod and fixed anchor points also seems innovative from my North American perspective.

I have used an inkle loom myself and it is very similar in the way it works. I think the biggest difference it that the inkle loom is more portable and it is limited in the length that it can make.  I have to say, I think her loom is more practical.  Lovely woman who is obviously proud of her work.  Nice video.

A very interesting video. Can I ask would she use the cloth to then make clothing or was it simply just a trade item? Also, is this the maximum width she could produce? I'm always amazed by peoples ingenuity with limited technology at their disposal, and thank you for posting the video.
respect

Thank you so much for showing not only the weaving process but the details of the loom set up, something a lot of videographers fail to do.  The long threads are the warp.  She's using a counterbalance loom set up (search this term to learn more).  She beats the weft thread to the fell of the cloth with what we call a reed. The weft thread is passed between the warp threads (in what's called a shed), This thread is stored on what we call a shuttle. Thank you again for sharing this. It's awesome.
I love the rudimentary yet perfected style of that whole system.

I think that we in the industrialized world miss out on the organic and soulful handmade objects. You can see that beyond the good craftsman(woman)ship of the item, her intangible worth--care, effort, history, is there too. :) God bless!
